data.title: Documentary: Olga
data.meta_description: The National Gallery of Art will feature director Miroslav Janek's documentary Olga in the East
data.text:
The film presents previously unknown footage, photos, and stories, revealing Olga as a sharp observer, principled dissident, generous host and down-to-earth woman who despises pomp but loves gentle humour and always says what she thinks. Her friends confirm that even as the first lady of the Czech Republic, her approach to life did not change and she stood firmly with both feet on the ground. Explore the life of this remarkable woman who helped transform a nation. (Dir. Miroslav Janek, 2014, 87 min., Czech with English subtitles)

Event Details:

Date: November 20, 4 pm

Location: The National Gallery of Art

East Building Auditorium

4th and Constitution Avenue NW

Washington, DC 20565

Admission is free. | Reservations are not required.
